page.title: 08Pembrey Coastguards
page.content: The first lookout at Pembrey was completed in 1927. Pembrey Coastguard station became an Auxillary station in 1947. In 1970 the emphasis was laid on V.H.F. radio communications, 24 hour radio watch being kept on the marine distress frequencies. Today,1985,there are ten Auxillaries in the rescue team recruited from villagers. The watch area is patrolled three times a week, midweek,Saturday & Sunday, and last four hours. The patrol has three special functions: {1. Familiarisation 2. Pollution {3. Public Relations.}The regular Officers often say (in jest) that Coastguard work is 95% boredom and 5% panic! This does,however reflect quite accurately the difference between the mundane work of watchkeeping and the rush to get things organised when a distress call is recieved.
